intro: Ardisia meghalayensis, commonly known as the Meghalaya ardisia, is a species of flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its berries are red and contain several seeds, which are dispersed by birds. Ardisia meghalayensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its native habitat.
